publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority.

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors-That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty's Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority.
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Alex Johnstone*
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) David Mundell*
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Alex Fergusson*
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Phil Gallie*

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Brian Adam*

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Nick Johnston, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Nick Johnston, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam
S1M-1186 Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors (lodged on 14 September 2000) Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1186 Ben Wallace: Orderly Conduct of Fuel Protestors—That the Parliament commends the hauliers and farmers who have recently protested at Grangemouth and elsewhere in Scotland about fuel taxes for the orderly and responsible conduct of their protests and urges Her Majesty’s Government to address the concerns that have been expressed as a matter of priority. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Nick Johnston, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Mary Scanlon
